item.title: Judge Keeps Block on Inquiry Into Mar-a-Lago Files and Appoints Special Master
item.description: The Justice Department has threatened to go to an appeals court and seek an emergency stay if she did not agree to its proposal to resume a key part of the investigation.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage and Alan Feuer
item.media:credit: Emil Lippe for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Justice Department has been sparring with lawyers for Donald J. Trump over whether an independent arbiter, known as a special master, should review classified documents retrieved from his estate.

item.title: Railroad Workers Point to Punishing Schedules as Cause of Strike
item.description: Employees say the inflexibility of scheduling upended their personal lives. The companies say they maintained service while using fewer resources.
item.dc:creator: Noam Scheiber and Niraj Chokshi
item.media:credit: Dustin Chambers for The New York Times
item.media:description: Freight trains in Atlanta on Thursday. Unions said a tentative contract agreement addressed concerns about time off for medical reasons.

item.title: Mortgage Rates Jump Above 6% for First Time Since 2008
item.description: They have been on the rise since the start of the year as the Federal Reserve has affirmed its commitment to tame soaring inflation.
item.dc:creator: Tara Siegel Bernard
item.category: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
item.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Biden to Meet With Families of Griner and Paul Whelan
item.description: The fates of both Americans have been complicated by the deteriorating diplomatic relationship between the United States and Russia over President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear

item.title: Pope Francis: Arming Ukraine Can Be ‘Morally Acceptable'
item.description: The pontiff said that it is acceptable for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine so that the country can defend itself, but stressed that communication channels with Russia should remain open.
item.dc:creator: Elisabetta Povoledo
item.media:credit: Pavel Mikheyev/Reuters
item.media:description: Pope Francis spoke to reporters after attending an interfaith conference in Kazakhstan this week.

item.title: Roger Federer Came Along When Tennis Desperately Needed Him
item.description: Tennis had lost its cachet in the early 2000s before Federer made the classic sport modern and the modern sport classier.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Futterman
item.media:credit: Clive Brunskill /Allsport via Getty Images
item.media:description: Roger Federer in 2000, at age 18.

item.title: Roger Federer’s Retirement Makes Room for a New Era of Champions
item.description: Roger Federer’s retirement will auger opportunities for a new generation of players not named Rafael Nadal or Novak Djokovic.
item.dc:creator: David Waldstein
item.media:credit: Asanka Brendon Ratnayake for The New York Times
item.media:description: Roger Federer at the Australian Open in 2020.

item.title: Roger Federer’s Career in Photos
item.description: For more than two decades, tennis fans admired Roger Federer’s every move as he won 20 Grand Slam singles titles.
item.dc:creator: John Branch
item.media:credit: Calla Kessler/The New York Times

item.title: DeSantis and Abbott Intensify Fight Over Immigration
item.description: Decisions to bus migrants to the vice president’s residence and to fly others to Martha’s Vineyard were the latest attempts to provoke outrage over record arrivals at the border.
item.dc:creator: Will Sennott, Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Eileen Sullivan and Patricia Mazzei
item.media:credit: Matt Cosby for The New York Times
item.media:description: Migrants entered St. Andrew’s Episcopal Church in Edgartown, Mass., to meet with volunteers on Thursday, a day after being flown from Texas to Martha’s Vineyard.

item.title: The Political Calculations Behind DeSantis’s Migrant Flights North
item.description: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida sent migrants to Massachusetts. He aimed to make a point about President Biden, but immigration issues are nothing new.
item.dc:creator: Blake Hounshell
item.media:credit: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times
item.media:description: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida sent two planeloads of migrants to Martha’s Vineyard in Massachusetts this week to make a statement about immigration.

item.title: Migrant Crisis Puts N.Y. ‘Right to Shelter’ Law to the Test
item.description: The city’s obligation to provide a bed to anyone who asks is unique and has added urgency to its efforts to welcome more than 11,000 migrants.
item.dc:creator: Jeffery C. Mays
item.media:credit: Benjamin Norman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Mayor Eric Adams tours a new center to welcome asylum seekers arriving in New York.

item.title: 5 Russian Bullets Dashed an Opera Singer’s Dreams. Then He Reclaimed His Voice.
item.description: While on a rescue mission in Ukraine, Sergiy Ivanchuk was shot in the lungs, apparently ending his chance at opera stardom. His recovery is a marvel of medicine, chance and his own spirit.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon
item.media:credit: Lena Mucha for The New York Times
item.media:description: Sergiy Ivanchuk, a Ukrainian opera singer, spent months in the hospital after he was shot trying to save civilians fleeing Kharkiv.

item.title: Life on Mars? This Could Be the Place NASA’s Rover Helps Us Find It.
item.description: Rocks collected by Perseverance are filled with organic molecules, and they formed in a lake that would have been habitable a few billion years ago.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Chang
item.media:credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU/MSSS
item.media:description: A composite image taken by NASA’s Perseverance rover showing its robotic arm over a rocky area called Skinner Ridge in Jezero Crater on Mars.

item.title: Princess Anne’s Influence, and Workload, Rises in a Slimmed-Down Royal Family
item.description: Often appearing at more than 400 events a year, Anne is likely to become even more central as a trusted adviser to her brother, the king.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Andrew Milligan
item.media:description: Princess Anne at Balmoral Castle, in Scotland, on Saturday.

item.title: A Detailed Rundown of Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral Day
item.description: On Monday, dignitaries from across the globe will bid farewell to the queen at a service in Westminster Abbey.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bubola
item.category: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: Queen Elizabeth II has been lying in state at Westminster Hall since Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Gap and Kanye West Officially End Partnership
item.description: The Yeezy Gap apparel line deal, announced with much fanfare in 2020, was supposed to last 10 years and generate $1 billion in annual sales.
item.dc:creator: Jordyn Holman and Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Hiroko Masuike/The New York Times
item.media:description: People lined up outside the Gap store in Times Square in July when Yeezy Gap clothes went on sale.

item.title: The Spanish Beach Town That Keeps Calling You Back
item.description: Sitges, just south of Barcelona, has 17 beaches and a quiet, timeless charm that draws all kinds of visitors to return year after year.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Lobrano
item.media:credit: Maria Contreras Coll for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Plaça del Baluard is the entrance to the old town in Sitges and a favorite place for visitors to take photographs.

item.title: Why Is There Still No Strategy to Defeat Donald Trump?
item.description: Trump-bashing makes us feel good; it doesn’t turn the tide.
item.dc:creator: David Brooks
item.media:credit: Mark Peterson for The New York Times

item.title: Herschel Walker Tests the Importance of ‘Candidate Quality’
item.description: If he babbles his way to a win, we all lose.
item.dc:creator: Frank Bruni
item.media:credit: Ben Wiseman

item.title: There’s Terrific News About the New Covid Boosters, but Few Are Hearing It
item.description: These updated vaccines are more protective and could fight future variants and help stave off long Covid.
item.dc:creator: Zeynep Tufekci

item.title: Who’s Afraid of the Consumer Price Index?
item.description: There wasn’t really much news in that inflation report.

item.title: Britain 3, America 0
item.description: A third woman is now leading Britain. The U.S. has had, um ....

item.title: The Transcendent Power of Walking
item.description: Walking in my neighborhood taught me what running wild in the mountains couldn’t.

item.title: Extreme Religious Liberty Is Undermining Public Health
item.description: Recent rulings are empowering the moral judgments of a small but politically powerful group.

item.title: Lindsey Graham’s Unbelievably Cruel Abortion Ban
item.description: Either he doesn’t know how pregnancy works, or he doesn’t care.

item.title: The Run-Up: What Democrats and Republicans Got Wrong About Voters
item.description: What Democrats and Republicans got wrong about voters started with a pileup of flawed assumptions.

item.title: 在中国“鸡娃”，到了美国继续“鸡”？
item.description: 随着我女儿进入休斯敦一所专门录取资优特长生的初中，我感受到“鸡娃”的压力似乎无处不在。中国家长到了美国为何还要“鸡娃”？美国学校教育最重要的到底是什么？
item.dc:creator: Zhan Juan
item.media:credit: Illustration by Chloe Scheffe; photographs by Internet Archive; Ansel Adams, Esther Bubley, Warren K. Leffler and Russell Lee, via Library of Congress; Museums Victoria, Muhammad Haikal Sjurki, Note Thanun and New York Public Library, via Unsplash; and Mikus, via Wikimedia Commons

item.title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
item.description: Our TV critic recommends a sweet new farm show for children, a silly-spooky show for grown-ups and a terrific stand-up special.
item.dc:creator: Margaret Lyons
item.media:credit: Apple TV+
item.media:description: Levi Howden and various creatures in a scene from “Lovely Little Farm.”

item.title: Democrats Delay Senate Vote to Protect Gay Marriage as GOP Balks
item.description: The chief negotiators were short of the 10 Republican votes that would be needed to win passage, but hoped to draw more support after the November elections.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.media:credit: Michael Reynolds/EPA, via Shutterstock
item.media:description: Polls show that a majority of Americans support same-sex marriage, but Republicans are split.

item.title: In a First Study of Pakistan’s Floods, Scientists See Climate Change at Work
item.description: A growing field called attribution science is helping researchers rapidly assess the links between global warming and weather disasters.
item.dc:creator: Raymond Zhong
item.category: Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research
item.media:credit: Asif Hassan/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: An inundated home in Sindh Province, Pakistan. Floods have killed more than 1,500 across the country.

item.title: In ‘Cancer Alley,’ Judge Blocks Huge Petrochemical Plant
item.description: The company, an affiliate of Formosa Plastics, said it intended to move forward with the $9.4 billion complex in St. James Parish despite the ruling.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Friedman
item.media:credit: Gerald Herbert/Associated Press
item.media:description: An oil refinery in Reserve, La. Reserve is in St. John the Baptist Parish, which abuts St. James Parish in “Cancer Alley,” where the plastics plant would have been built.

item.title: How to Prevent Common Exercise Injuries
item.description: Here are the four exercises you’re most at risk of doing wrong — and what can keep you safe.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Fairbank

item.title: Gravel Biking is Getting Popular. Here’s How to Start.
item.description: A faster bicycle design with thicker tires is allowing cyclists to explore America’s 2.2 million miles of Here’s what you need to know about this new sport.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Singleton
item.media:credit: Alex Goodlett for The New York Times

item.title: How to Motivate Yourself to Exercise
item.description: Bundle your incentives. Be flexible. Get some support. Here’s how to get — and stay — motivated.
item.dc:creator: Christie Aschwanden
item.media:credit: Keith E. Morrison for The New York Times

item.title: A Full-Body Strength Training Workout at Home
item.description: If you’re willing to be creative, a set of elastic bands can be as effective as a gym full of weights.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Marder
item.media:credit: Cayce Clifford for The New York Times
item.media:description: In addition to resistance training, exercise bands can take the edge off of body weight exercises, like pull-ups. But trainers like Vanessa Liu warn against becoming too dependent on them.

item.title: Walking May Prevent New Knee Pain for Some, Study Suggests
item.description: Encouraging new research suggests walking could help prevent new bouts of knee pain in people with osteoarthritis.
item.dc:creator: Dani Blum
item.media:credit: Getty Images

item.title: The Eight Film Festival Movies That Got the Biggest Awards Boost
item.description: “Women Talking,” women fighting, a pair of Brendans and more: After Toronto, Venice and Telluride, here are the titles and performances in the conversation.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.category: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed (Movie)
